alert.note: Alert for Snohomish (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 04 at 11:32PM PDT until November 05 at 8:58PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Snohomish River Near Monroe affecting Snohomish County. .Five to seven inches of rain fell in the Central Cascades Friday. This will push the Snohomish River near Monroe over flood stage saturday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snohomish River Near Monroe. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, the Snohomish River will cause minor flooding of low pasture lands and several roads near the river. A stage of 15 feet at this location corresponds to Phase 2 in the Snohomish County Flood Warning System. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM PDT Friday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise cresting Saturday morning near 15.5 feet late tonight. The river will fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 730 AM PDT.
